text:
Legal Zoom has existed as
a company for 20 years,
and the technology started to get dated.
We try to be proactive,
we try to stay on top of everything,

but there are occasions
when things get busy
and that gets put in the back burner.

But our AWS Enterprise
Support Team is always able

to bring that back and make
it focal and center for us.

Our AWS Enterprise Support
was able to provide us

with regular updates on
security vulnerabilities
that we had within our environment,

and made it easy for our
engineers to know exactly

where to focus in order to
make sure that our applications
were kept up to date and secure.

We were able to successfully
migrate 450 servers,
terabytes of data,

and with minimal amount
of priority one issues
that arose during the migration.
We realized that as we were approaching
the big migration day,

that we actually had a plan
to move over a weekend.
It makes it difficult for handing off

between different support
staff if we did have issues.

And so by using AWS Countdown,
we knew we had a team
who was able to actually handle it,
and then we didn't have to worry
about managing tickets ourselves.

Post-migration, our company
has been able to launch
new SaaS applications faster than ever,

and if we acquire a new
company, it makes it much easier

for us to integrate their
product within ours,
because we're running in AWS.
